<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Pirate Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6378) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=572" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 209 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Pirate](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=258)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40)

</column>

---

As a pirate, you sail the seas in search of enemy ships to plunder and great adventures to embark on. You gain the [Additional Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=5114) general feat for Sailing Lore or for a specific coastal city you have a connection to (such as Port Peril Lore). You ignore the effects of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=2366) or [uneven ground](/Rules.aspx?ID=2370) caused by unstable ground (such as the deck of a ship). Additionally, you gain the Boarding Assault action. 

 **Boarding Assault** <actions string="Two Actions" />  ([flourish](/Traits.aspx?ID=606)) Either [Stride](/Actions.aspx?ID=2305) twice or attempt an [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) check (DC determined by the GM, but usually DC 20) to swing up to twice your Speed on a rope or similar object, then [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306). If you boarded or disembarked from a boat or similar vehicle during this movement, the Strike deals one additional weapon damage die.

<title level="2">Pirate Dedication leads to...</title>
[Pirate Combat Training](/Feats.aspx?ID=6379), [Rope Runner](/Feats.aspx?ID=6380), [Walk the Plank](/Feats.aspx?ID=6381)
name: Pirate Dedication
